notes: Duggan & Scott Morton (2010) study the effect of Medicare Part D on drug prices. Cross-sectional regressions of log change in price-per-day (2003-2006) on Medicare market share across brand-name drugs. Tables 2-5 in the paper. Two main baseline groups: one for price effects (Table 2) and one for quantity effects (Table 3).

design_audit.selection_story: Selection-on-observables: cross-drug variation in Medicare market share is exogenous conditional on drug age and generic competition status
design_audit.notes: Table 2 Column 4 is the preferred specification: drops outliers (lppd0603 in [-1.1, 1.095]), drops cancer drugs (thercat!=8), weighted by total 2002-2003 MEPS prescription count. Robust (HC1) standard errors.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log change in price-per-day from 2003 to 2006 (inflation-adjusted)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Medicare market share of prescriptions (pooled 2002-2003 MEPS)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of Medicare Part D market share on brand-name drug price growth -- marginal impact of a 1-unit increase in Medicare Rx share on log price change
claim_object.target_population: Top 1000 brand-name (non-OTC, non-generic) drugs by 2003 IMS sales, on market by 2003

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col4
baseline_specs.sample_restrictions: imsgrouprank03<=1000, otc==2, imsgbo==2, fdayear<=2003, smallcat!=., lppd0603>=-1.100, lppd0603<=1.095, thercat!=8

constraints.notes: Baseline uses 2 controls (yrs03onmkt, anygen). Additional controls available: protected, smallcat, mcar0203prot (Medicare share x protected class), scmcar0203 (Medicare share x small category), lppd0201 (lagged price change). Max 8 if interactions are counted separately.

canonical.notes: Robust (HC1) standard errors, matching the paper's baseline `reg ..., robust`.

variants.notes: Clustered by therapeutic category, used in Table 5 of the paper.

budgets.notes: Moderate budget. Control pool is small (5-8 variables), so exhaustive enumeration of key subsets is feasible. Main variation comes from sample restrictions and outcome/treatment definitions.

sampling.notes: Small control pool makes exhaustive enumeration feasible for most blocks. Random sampling for joint axis combinations.

design_audit.selection_story: Selection-on-observables: cross-drug variation in Medicare market share is exogenous conditional on drug age and generic competition status
design_audit.notes: Table 3 Column 4 is the preferred specification: drops outliers, drops cancer drugs, weighted by total MEPS scripts. Robust standard errors.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log change in total doses from 2003 to 2006
claim_object.treatment_concept: Medicare market share of prescriptions (pooled 2002-2003 MEPS)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of Medicare Part D market share on brand-name drug quantity growth -- marginal impact of a 1-unit increase in Medicare Rx share on log dose change
claim_object.target_population: Top 1000 brand-name (non-OTC, non-generic) drugs by 2003 IMS sales, on market by 2003

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col4
baseline_specs.sample_restrictions: imsgrouprank03<=1000, otc==2, imsgbo==2, fdayear<=2003, smallcat!=., ldoses0603>=-3.95, ldoses0603<=1.51, thercat!=8

constraints.notes: Same control pool as G1. Additional Table 3 Col 7 drops drugs facing generic competition (anygen==0).

canonical.notes: Robust (HC1) standard errors, matching the paper's baseline.

variants.notes: Clustered by therapeutic category (used in Table 5).

budgets.notes: Smaller budget than G1 since this is the secondary quantity outcome.
